title: Opare Returns To Training
text:
Sports News | 14 October 2015 17:56 CET Opare Returns To Training By Daily Guide 
Daniel Opare Ghana defender Daniel Opare has returned to training at German Bundesliga side after a six-week injury lay off, Africanfootball.com has exclusively reported. 
The right-back joined the rest of his teammates last Wednesday for the first since picking up an injury on his first work-out with the team in mid-August. 
Opare, a new signing on a free transfer, suffered a tear in his right thigh. 
The uncertainty surrounding his return forced the club to exclude him from their Europa League squad. 
The 24-year-old hopes he can recapture his athleticism and break into the Augsburg first team. 
'It was a long time,' says Opare. 'It felt really good to go out there to train. When injured, as a new player in the new club in the first practice, it is really difficult. I was very disappointed, but everyone has helped me to keep my head up.' 
Opare was signed to replace compatriot Baba Rahman who was sold to English champions Chelsea.
